main event: Two UFO sightings were recorded, one at Goose AFB in Labrador on 2 September 1952 and another in Reidsville, North Carolina on 17 October 1952.
interesting points: The Goose AFB sighting described an object resembling an aircraft observed on a GCA radar traveling at approximately 25 miles per hour at an altitude of less than 4000 feet.
The Reidsville sighting involved a radar signal resembling an aircraft at an altitude of 3,500 feet traveling at 300 knots, but no visual confirmation of an aircraft was made.
In both cases, all aircraft in the area were reportedly accounted for, suggesting that the observed objects were unidentified.
The UFO report from Goose AFB suggested that the object was likely a balloon, while the Reidsville report did not provide a conclusion regarding the nature of the observed object.
Both sightings involved observation by credible witnesses, including military personnel such as a Major in the USAF.
location: Goose AFB, Labrador and Reidsville, North Carolina
